Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery krater; white slip; paint fired orange; interior glazed with broad in added red lined in white; exterior: to left, glazed area presumably at handle; in panel to right, black-figure decoration consisting of animal frieze (hind legs and one foreleg of deer) with three splinter rosettes as filling ornament; below, broken maeander frieze; ridge at turn to shoulder and tongue frieze at top of shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.480)
